job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p><u>Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</u></p><p>Palo Alto, CA, United States</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>About Yo Labs:</u></strong></p><p>Technology has changed daily life in a way no one could have imagined.&nbsp;It’s made us more productive, capable and connected.&nbsp;But it has come at a cost.&nbsp;We’re productive, but overwhelmed.&nbsp;Capable but paralyzed by too many choices.&nbsp;Connected, but only if social media counts.&nbsp;Living this way creates a void in our daily lives.&nbsp;Yo Labs is here to change that.&nbsp;Our team is committed to alleviating the mental load that our modern world has created by putting human connection back into technology and care-taking at the heart of everything we create.</p><p><br></p><p>As part of a growing team, you will work on various aspects of the tooling and infrastructure, including security and identity, kubernetes clusters, CI/CD systems, services federation, mesh technologies.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Job Duties:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Design and build tooling, automation, and services that enable productivity across the entire organization.&nbsp;</li><li>Improve security posture of the organization by way of tooling, policy, example code, and publishing best practices.&nbsp;</li><li>Design and automate lifecycle for cloud resources including EKS/Kubernetes, VMs, IoT Core, IAM users/roles, etc…&nbsp;</li><li>Design and implement observability solution enabling developers self service debugging and alerting capabilities.&nbsp;</li><li>Dive and support our IDP and SSO solution from corp network into cloud/production systems.&nbsp;</li><li>Help to manage CI/CD systems, tooling, and general automation.&nbsp;</li><li>Define, build, and evangelize best practices for a kubernetes based architecture.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Qualifications:</u></strong></p><ul><li>BA/BS degree or equivalent experience</li><li>10+ or more years of system and site reliability engineering experience</li><li>Knowledge of the primary AWS services (EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53 &amp; S3)</li><li>Knowledge of IDPs such as Google’s G-Suite and Okta</li><li>First hand experience kubernetes running in AWS</li><li>Experience deploying microservices using an envoy based mesh</li><li>Leading highly-available and fault-tolerant enterprise and web-scale software deployments</li><li>Infrastructure automation through code and general scripting (E.g. go, bash, python)</li><li>Configuration management using Terraform</li><li>Strong practical Linux systems administration skills in a cloud and containerized environment</li><li>Experience managing cloud operations, including data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications</li><li>Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges</li><li>Experience leading discussions across teams regarding trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>What We Offer:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Competitive compensation package</li><li>Comprehensive benefits</li><li>Pet Insurance</li><li>Paid Parental Care Leave</li><li>Employee Referral Program</li><li>Educational Assistance</li><li>Flexible Work Program</li><li>Volunteer time Off</li><li>Total Well Being Program</li></ul>
